授業目的: Refer to Class Purpose in English
到達目標: Refer to Achievement Goals in English
授業方法:
The class will involve lectures, small group discussions, writing assignments, videos, and handouts.
Classes are conducted face-to-face in the classroom.
The online class participants will receive both simultaneous online interactive delivery during class time and on-demand materials.

第1回:
Overview of course and discussion on students’ goals. Introduction to ethnic and national identity.

Writing assignment: Students will describe their own identity; that is, what is important to who they are such as ethnicity, gender, race, national origin, religion, etc.
By reflecting on your personal journey, it will help to put the issues we will be discussing in a context that is unique to you. No more than two pages, maybe three, please.

You should answer some of these questions, though you may choose to address other issues as well:

How do you identify yourself? For example, do you identify yourself by gender, religion, national origin, race, class, etc.

You must answer the following:

Share your story of a person you’ve met, or a book you’ve read, or a play or movie you’ve seen, or a place you’ve visited that has made a difference in the way you look at the world today and why this is so.
第2回:
Autobiography

Class discussion on personal identity and beliefs.
第5回:
National Identity and Nationalism

What is Nationalism? How does it differ from Ethnic Pride?
第6回:
Immigration and Culture

How has immmigration affected a nation's culture?
第13回: The Future of Identity in a Flat World

評価.教科書Required texts0: There are no required texts. Handouts will be given prior to classes.
